intro: Palicourea jenaro-herrerana, commonly known as the Herreran's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with tubular corollas. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
